short_definition: An intentional and voluntary giving up, relinquishment, renunciation or surrender of a known right; before a court may accept a defendant's plea of guilty to a charge, the record must indicate in some manner that the defendant understands the nature and consequences of the plea and that he freely, voluntarily and intelligently waives his rights.
